Generation I.Red: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.
Generation I.Yellow: One claw grew massively and as hard as steel. It has 10,000-HP strength. However, it is too heavy.
Generation I.Stadium: Said to be capable of prying open Shellder and Cloyster shells using its 10,000-horsepower pincer.

Generation II.Gold: It can hardly lift its massive, overgrown pincer. The pincer's size makes it difficult to aim properly.
Generation II.Silver: Its pincers grow peculiarly large. If it lifts the pincers too fast, it loses its balance and staggers.
Generation II.Crystal: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it's not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It can hardly lift its massive, overgrown pincer. The pincer's size makes it difficult to aim properly. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its pincers grow peculiarly large. If it lifts the pincers too fast, it loses its balance and staggers. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)
